item.title: McKinney Creative Writing Workshop to be Held 2/21
item.description: Have a story that could inspire others? Ready to raise your voice in solidarity with your community? Want to share your experiences with environmental or social activism? Get help composing or revising an essay, poem, or story for submission to the McKinney Writing for Social Change Contest with author and activist D. Colin on 2/21 at 12pm in the Fischbach Conference Room, on the second floor of the Folsom Library.

item.title: Don’t Forget Those Therapy Dog Sessions!
item.description: Date: Thursday, February 6, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM - Join other students in the Mueller Center classroom to relax, de-stress, and pet some furry friends! If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center.

item.title: OGE Online Dissertation and Thesis Preparation Workshop to be held February 19
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 2:30 PM - 4:00 PM - Learn the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles—plus a review of the most commonly found mistakes and ways to avoid them. This workshop is for any student who will be writing an MS thesis or PhD dissertation. Bring your questions! Register here!

item.title: STS Guest Speaker Caroline Woolard to give "Design in Society" talk
item.description: What institutions - financial, educational, and cultural - might be required to produce designers who imagine contributions to social justice as obvious to the field of design? This talk presents a design methodology which considers the dynamic relationship between discrete objects (“products”) and long-term collaborative networks (“platforms”). Join us in Sage 5711 from 11:30am-1pm on 2/5.

item.title: Cognitive Science Colloquium Scheduled for February 5th
item.description: Join the Cognitive Science Department in Carnegie 113 for a presentation by Dr. Jerome Busemeyer (Distinguished Professor, Indiana University Bloomington) titled “Using Quantum Probability to Understand Contextual Reasoning”. Event runs 12pm- 1:30pm.

item.title: 02/13/2025 9am to 11am open on-campus office hours held by IBM quantum support
item.description: IBM quantum support will be holding open on-campus office hours Thursday, February 13th from 9am to 11am ET in CII 3159. During this time, IBM personnel will be available to answer questions regarding your specific applications about quantum computing, quantum algorithms, and other quantum computer questions you may have. For additional information about RPI Quantum Computing, please visit https://quantum.rpi.edu

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Schedules February 7 Info Session
item.description: Date: Friday, February 7, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. item.title: Annual 2025 McKinney Student Awards Ceremony and Speaker Series to be held April 9
item.description: The 83rd annual McKinney Reading Series and Student Awards Ceremony is Wednesday, April 9th, 7:00-9:00 p.m. featuring Lan Samantha Chang, winner of the Anisfield-Wolf Book Award for Fiction and the PEN Open Book Award. The event will feature the announcement of McKinney Student Writing Contest winners, a fiction reading, and audience Q & A. An opportunity to purchase books and meet the author will follow.

item.title: Analytics, Machine Learning and AI Review
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., on a 30-minute information session highlighting Rensselaer online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Analytics, Machine Learning & AI. item.title: HR to Hold Professional Development Workshop, “Leading from Anywhere”
item.description:
Description: At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. In this workshop, scheduled to be held from 9am to 11am on February 20, participants will explore the tenants that comprise everyday leadership and discuss the behaviors that define leadership not as positional or based on title, but rather on values and actions.
